DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Cancer Third Recurrent Disease Biochemical Diagnosis Year Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the year of the third biochemical recurrence.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Carcinoma Third Recurrent Disease Biochemical Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Prostate carcinoma is one of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.  -- 2002_Following the second position in an ordering or series._The return of a disease after a period of remission._Biochemical; of or relating to biochemistry; involving chemical processes in living organisms._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Prostate carcinoma is one of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.  -- 2002:Following the second position in an ordering or series.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.

Concepts.definition: One of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.
Following the second position in an ordering or series; coming next after the second and just before the fourth in position.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Property.preferredDefinition: Biochemical; of or relating to biochemistry; involving chemical processes in living organisms.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to biochemistry; involving chemical processes in living organisms.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by B.McClure-Shimel. mc 1/18/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Event; something that happens at a given place and time._The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Event; something that happens at a given place and time.:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Something that happens at a given place and time.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
